Welcome to ASP.NET Zero startup project!

In this demo, you can use the left menu to test the application. This dashboard page is just for demonstration, but all other pages and functionalities are fully implemented, working and ready for production. You can add/apply your business requirements on this startup project (or remove any functionality you don't need). Thus, you can have a signification time gain to immediately start your own project requirements.

Welcome to the application. You can use the menu to start using the application. If you don't see any menu item, probably you don't have permission to see any page. Consider asking a system administrator for permissions.
A password reset link sent to your e-mail address. Please check your emails.
Use security image question (captcha) on registration.

Write only username for same tenant users,
[tenancyName]\[userName] for other tenant's users

for example:
.\admin -> for host admin
Test\admin -> for test tenant's admin
admin -> for your tenant's admin

This page allows you to manage legal documents that are displayed to users of the application. You can add, edit, and delete documents as needed.
Each document must have a type (Privacy Policy or Terms of Service) which determines where it appears in the application.
You can upload HTML files for rich formatting or PDF files for standardized display. HTML files can be previewed directly in the browser.
Alternatively, you can provide an external URL if your legal documents are hosted elsewhere.
Fill out the form below to create or edit a legal document. All fields marked with * are required.
Select the type of legal document you are creating or editing.
If your document is hosted on another website, enter the full URL here. Users will be redirected to this URL when they click to view the document.
Upload an HTML or PDF file containing your legal document. HTML files allow for rich formatting and can be previewed directly in the browser.
The HTML content has been sanitized to remove potentially harmful elements. The preview may not exactly match the final appearance.
